title: Julianne Hough and Brooks Laich pay tributes to her fur babies Lexi and Harley after they pass away
text:
Julianne Hough and husband Brooks Laich have paid moving Instagram tributes to her two dogs, after both died.

The Cavalier King Charles spaniels passed away on the same day, September 28, when Lexi was 11 and Harley was eight. The cause of death has not been revealed.

And on Saturday, the pro-dancer, 31, posted snaps and videos of her dogs with a long and touching caption.

Scroll down for video

'Pure love is real': Julianne Hough cuddled her Cavalier King Charles spaniels Harley, left, eight and Lexi, 11, in this Instagram snap she posted to announce their deaths

'Pure love is real, it existed through us,' she wrote. 'My heart expanded and felt the truth of what is possible. I am forever grateful.

'Thank you for your love. Thank you for being my babies, my daughters. Thank you for choosing me. Thank you for teaching me how to be your mother.

'Thank you for allowing me to give and receive love. Thank you for your kisses. Thank you for your blessings every single minute of every single day. Thank you for your souls. Thank you for protecting me. Thank you for letting me protect you. Thank you for protecting each other.

'Thank you for the timeless memories. Thank you for your magic. Thank you for being the most consistent and constant beings in my life. Thank you for being you. Thank you for being my guardians on this earth and even more so now.

'I’ve never experienced a love like ours. I miss you. I love you forever. Now You Are Free.'

So cute: Julianne's ice hockey pro husband Brooks Laich, 31, shared his own memories of Lexi and Harley saying: 'Their tragic passing has left my wife and I heartbroken'

Adored dogs: Eight-year-old Harley, left, and Lexi, 11, both died on September 28

Paws up: Julianne, 31, wrote, 'Thank you for your blessings every single minute of every single day. Thank you for your souls. Thank you for protecting me'

Her ice hockey pro husband of two years, Brooks Laich, 31, posted his own tribute.

'It is with the heaviest heart that I share with you the passing of our beloved dogs Lexi and Harley,' he said. 'Their tragic passing has left my wife and I heartbroken. Lexi and Harley were not just pets to us, they were our children, and we loved them as such.

'They were the purest example to love that I have ever seen. They showed me that true love did exist in the world.

Loved up: 'Thank you for choosing me. Thank you for teaching me how to be your mother'

Striking a pose: ' 'Thank you for allowing me to give and receive love;

'The way they loved their mom @juleshough and the way she loved them back was the first time I knew that there was hope for me to have love in my life

'And they accepted me into their little family, and helped me become a dad for the first time. 'The past 2 weeks have been filled with tears of sorrow, and tears of joy. The immense pain we feel by their loss is due to the overwhelming love we had for them.

'Every single beautiful part of them will be missed, but we trust that they are in a better place now, and can still feel their presence in our hearts.'

'Forever grateful': Julianne gushed. 'My heart expanded and felt the truth of what is possible'

So adorable: 'Thank you for your love. Thank you for being my babies, my daughters. Thank you for choosing me. Thank you for teaching me how to be your mother'

The hunky athlete went on to thank all the people who have helped them in the weeks since the pups' passing.

He added: 'Thank you to my wife for allowing me to share in their world, and trusting me to be their dad. I wasn’t perfect, but I loved them with every ounce of my heart.

'And thank you Lexi and Harley, for teaching me grace, softening my heart, and showing me love. You are perfect, and may you Rest In Peace.'

Ready to fly: Julianne and Laich still have one dog at home, a husky puppy they adopted in November, here seen at LAX in August

Daddy's dog: The husky looked up lovingly at Brooks as he lay in the athlete's arms

The couple still have one dog at home, a husky puppy they adopted in November.

Meanwhile, she and her brother Derek, 34, were spotted leaving a friend's house on Friday.

Julianne, who went barefoot, looked chic in a blue and black plaid dress while Derek donned a white polo shirt and green cargo pants.

Out and about: Julianne was spotted leaving a friend's house in Los Angeles on Friday

On her toes: The pro-dancer wore a blue plaid mini-dress and didn't bother with shoes
